resources.string: The Honeycomb Works
Know what you want to work on? Let\'s get started.
If you want to change a habit or learn something new you\'re more likely to be successful when you:
1. Write it down
2. Set time aside to work on the change you want to make
3. Identify what could stop you
4. Plan what you\'ll do to stay on track
Click \'Start\' and we\'ll walk you through it. We\'ll also send you reminders over the next few weeks to keep you on track
4 min to complete
Start
First name
Last name
Email*
We will only use this information to send you reminders and follow ups to see how you got on
What habit do you want to work on? Select from the drop down menu.
What situations could I try this in? What opportunities to practice do I have? This question is required.*
When am I going to work on this habit?
Set aside a date in the next week when you know you\'ll have an opportunity to work on it and add to your calendar to make sure you stick to your commitment

I\'ve planned what I\'m going to do and when. What might stop me or get in my way? These could be practical things (e.g important tasks) or other things (e.g. personal fears or concerns)This question is required. *
This step is really important - by considering the things that could stop you, you\'ll be able to come up with strategies to make sure they don\'t
What can I do to make sure these things don\'t stop me? What can I do now or what can I tell myself to make sure I go ahead?This question is required. *
People who plan how to deal with the things that could stop them are much more likely to stick to their commitments
Submit
